title: Indiatimes entertainment news:Adil Hussain Joins Star Trek: Discovery Season 3, Man Kicked Out Of Joker Screening & More From Ent
text:
1. 'English Vinglish' & 'Life Of Pi' Actor Adil Hussain Joins The Cast Of Star Trek: Discovery Season 3

The 56-year-old actor has acted in many English, Hindi, Assamese, Bengali, Tamil, Marathi, Malayalam, Norwegian and even French movies. And making us proud all over again, he is now joining the cast of Star Trek: Discovery season 3.

2. Man Kicked Out Of Joker Screening For Spitting At People & Cheering Loudly When Characters Died

“This is the guy who spent our entire screening of JOKER in NYC spitting at people and clapping whenever Joker killed somebody. Security escorted him out after a third of the audience fled the theater out of fear that he’d start hurting people,” tweeted a witness at the AMC Empire 25 theatre.

So much so, that #ShutDownFilmCity was trending on Twitter. Many people claim that Film City has encroached more of the Aarey Colony’s area than what is being now encroached for metro shed. People on social media claimed that Bollywood is equally responsible for the destruction of Aarey Colony.

“Please note @Marvel officials, you can’t use my name #kamalakhan without my permission. You can’t just add an A and get away. You should take permission from me or I will go to court against you,” he wrote on Twitter.

5. Maisie Williams Says Game Of Thrones Makers Put Strap Across Her Chest To Flatten Breast Growth

“They would also put this strap across my chest to flatten any growth that had started, and I don't know, that just felt horrible for six months of the year,” Maisie was quoted as saying by USA Today, according to IANS.
description: From Adil Hussain joining the cast of Star Trek: Discovery Season 3, whose trailer was released at the New York Comic-con to a man being kicked out of the screening of Joker for spitting at people and cheering and applauding on the scenes when somebody died in the theatre, here is all that rocked the world of entertainment today.
